decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: To comply with the provisions of Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:ETP24 J173 003PP  Rev 4 Block PlanETP24 J173 004PP  Rev 9 Floor PlanETP24 J173 005PP  Rev 5 Roof PlanETP24 J173 006PP  Rev 9 ElevationsETP24 J173 007PP  Rev 8 Side ElevationsETP24 J173 008PP  Rev 6 SectionsETP24 J173 009PP  Rev 4 DemolitionETP24 J173 010PP  Rev 4 Fire SafetyETP24 J173 017PP  Rev 1 Windows detailsETP24 J173 018PP  Rev 1 Windows detailsETP24 J173 019PP  Rev 1 CladdingETP24 J173 020PP  Rev  0 Sliding door detailsPhoto Report on condition of cafe and repairs and refurbishmentMaterials Guide Heritage Window Materials Report Flood Risk Assessment  Dated 12.05.2025 (insofar as it relates to SuDs information only - not flooding)Heriatge Statement Design & Access StatementReason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

All new external work shall be carried out in materials that resemble, as closely as possible, in colour and texture those specified in the approved application.Any alterations to the approved design or location of the kitchen extract and plant enclosures, particularly where they may increase visibility from the park, shall require the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.Any boundary treatments not expressly approved as part of this permission shall also require the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To preserve the character and appearance of the Conservation Area, in accordance with national and local heritage policies.

Prior to occupation of the development, a Flood Risk Technical Note shall be submitted to  and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The technical note shall demonstrate:o                          There is no net loss of floodplain storage, with level-for-level flood compensation provided;o                          A Flood Management Plan is in place, including provision of a dry access route within the low hazard area of the floodplain, as defined by the Environment Agency's Flood Risk Assessment Guidance for New Development (R&D Technical Report FD2320);o                          Appropriate flood-resistant and resilient construction measures are incorporated into the development.The measures once agreed shall be implemented in full prior to occupation and retained for the lifetime of the development. Reason: To minimise flood risk to and from the development in accordance with Policy CP28 of the Core Strategy, Policies SI 12 of the London Plan, DMD Policies 59, 60 and 62, the Strategic Flood Risk Assessment (SFRA), and the National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF).

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with proposed SuDS measures. In particular:o                          Details of the proposed SuDS measures including sizes, cross-sections, management, levels and connections shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. o                          These measures shall be implemented in full prior to occupation and retained for the lifetime of the development. Reason: To ensure the sustainable management of water, minimise flood risk, minimise discharge of surface water outside of the curtilage of the property and ensure that the drainage system will remain functional throughout the lifetime of the development in accordance with Policy CP28 of the Core Strategy, DMD Policy 61, and Policies SI12 & SI13 of the London Plan and the NPPF and to maximise opportunities for sustainable development, improve water quality, biodiversity, local amenity and recreation value
